metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5327 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Out-of-bounds memory read in the x509_decode_time function in x509_cert_parser.c in Linux kernels 4.3-rc1 and after.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.3.0-1-generic - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-generic-lpae - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-lowlatency - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc-e500mc - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc-smp - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc64-emb - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc64-smp - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-extra-4.3.0-1-generic - 4.3.0-1.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> While fd19a3d195be23e8d9d0d66576b96ea25eea8323 looks like the actual introduction of this issue, the code before this point didn't appear to do any date validation; perhaps the 'break' point ought to be the introduction of the crypto/asymmetric_keys/x509_cert_parser.c file instead. jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
